Rel. v. 367 Rib.); <cit><quote lang="la">so of stars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 5</bibl></cit> (240); 107 (348).—</sense><sense id="n8493.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n8493.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be obvious</hi> or <hi rend="ital">clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">evident</hi> or <hi rend="ital">manifest</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quod in primo quoque carmine claret,</quote> <trans><tr>which is evident also in the first canto</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:937" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 937</bibl></cit>: mihi satis claret, with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Sev. 20, 4</bibl> Spald. and Zumpt <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n8493.3" n="B" level="2"> Of character, <hi rend="ital">to be distinguished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">illustrious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">famous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">renowned</hi> (ante-class.): (Fab. Maximi) gloria claret, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:4:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 4, 10</bibl> (Ann. v. 315 Vahl.); Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 85, 22</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 152 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
claresco: <entryFree id="n8494" type="main" key="cla_resco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clāresco</orth>, <itype>clārui, 3</itype>, <sense id="n8494.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [clareo] (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> or in post-Aug. prose), <hi rend="ital">to become</hi> or <hi rend="ital">grow bright</hi> or <hi rend="ital">clear.</hi> </sense><sense id="n8494.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n8494.2" n="A" level="2"> Of the sight, <hi rend="ital">to begin to shine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">become visible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecta luminibus clarescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clarescit dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 123" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 123</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 3</bibl>; cf. Claud. Nupt. Hon. et Mar. 185 al.—</sense><sense id="n8494.3" n="B" level="2"> Of the hearing, <hi rend="ital">to sound clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become audible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clarescunt sonitus armorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 301</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 11, 7</bibl></cit>: vox, Gabius Bassus ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:7:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 7, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8494.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n8494.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To become clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manifest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">evident</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obvious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alid ex alio clarescet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1115</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1456" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1456</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba ipso materiae nitore clarescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:61" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:19" default="NO">8, 5, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:9" default="NO">6, 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 2, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8494.6" n="B" level="2"> In character, <hi rend="ital">to become illustrious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">famous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">renowned</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">aliud clarescit et e contemptibus exit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:833" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 833</bibl></cit> Lachm. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoquo facinore clarescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnis inimicitiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia facilius inter ancipitia clarescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> C. Mall. Theod. 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex gente Domitiā duae familiae claruerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gram. 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
claricito: <entryFree id="n8495" type="main" key="cla_ri^ci^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clārĭcĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. clarigito.</entryFree>
clarico: <entryFree id="n8496" type="main" key="cla_ri^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clārĭco</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>clarus</etym>, <sense id="n8496.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to glow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gleam</hi>: ignes pernicitate sui claricantes, App. de Mundo, 15, p. 63.</sense></entryFree>
clarificatio: <entryFree id="n8497" type="main" key="cla_ri^fi^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clārĭfĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>clarifico</etym>, <sense id="n8497.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a glorification</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Domini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Qu. 83:62" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Qu. 83, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Ep. 77, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
clarifico: <entryFree id="n8498" type="main" key="cla_ri^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clārĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>clarus - facio</etym>, <sense id="n8498.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make illustrious</hi> or <hi rend="ital">famous</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">nomen suum grandi aliquo facinore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 18, p. 213</bibl></cit> Bip.; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 4, 173</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 26, 304 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
clarigatio: <entryFree id="n8499" type="main" key="cla_ri^ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clārĭgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>clarigo</etym>, <sense id="n8499.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a solemn demand for redress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a religious solemnity with which the</hi> Fetialis <hi rend="ital">declared war upon an enemy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in case he should refuse to give satisfaction within</hi> 33 <hi rend="ital">days for injuries sustained</hi> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 9, 53</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 14</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Dict. of Antiq.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, epit. libr. 22, 3, p. 69 Bip.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 13</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32:5 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 32, 5 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n8499.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a fine</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ransom</hi> for a transgression of limits, to be exacted of the offender by any person finding him: <cit><quote lang="la">(Veliterni) jussi trans Tiberim habitare, ut ejus, qui cis Tiberim deprehensus esset, usque ad mille passuum clarigatio esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 14, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
clarigito: <entryFree id="n8500" type="hapax" key="cla_ri^gi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clārĭgĭto</orth> (in the MSS. <orth extent="full" lang="la">clārĭcĭto</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n8500.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq.</hi> [clarigo], <hi rend="ital">to recall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recollect;</hi> saecla ferarum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:947" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 947</bibl>; v. Lachm. ad h. l.</sense></entryFree>
clarigo: <entryFree id="n8501" type="main" key="cla_ri^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clārĭgo</orth>, no <sense id="n8501.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, ātum, 1, <hi rend="ital">v.n.</hi> [clarus]; t. t. of the Fetiales, <hi rend="ital">to proclaim war against an enemy with certain religious ceremonies</hi> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32:5 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 32, 5 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 9, 53</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 14</bibl>; Dict. of Antiq.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 2, 3, § 5</bibl>; cf. clarigatio, and Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:947" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 947</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
clarisonus: <entryFree id="n8502" type="main" key="cla_ri^so^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clārĭ-sŏnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n8502.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">clearsounding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinct</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:320" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 320</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:125" default="NO" valid="yes">64, 125</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurae Aquilonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=280" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 280</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
clarissimatus: <entryFree id="n8503" type="main" key="cla_rissi^ma_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clārissĭmātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>clarissimus; v. clarus, II. B.</etym>, <sense id="n8503.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the dignity of a</hi> Clarissimus (late Lat.), Cod. Th. 6, 24, 9; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 16, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
claritas: <entryFree id="n8504" type="main" key="cla_ri^tas1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clārĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>clarus</etym>, <sense id="n8504.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">clearness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brightness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">splendor</hi> (in good prose, most freq. in the post-Aug. per.). </sense><sense id="n8504.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n8504.2" n="A" level="2"> Of objects affecting the sight (so for the most part only in Pliny the elder): <cit><quote lang="la">sidus Veneris claritatis tantae (est), ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 8, 6, § 37</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 8, 6, § 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:84" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 4, 41, § 84</bibl>: <cb n="CLAR" /> matutina, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 35, 54, § 107</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">visus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 10, 46, § 116</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">oculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 11, 29, § 114</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:108" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 10, 42, § 108</bibl>: AD CLARITATEM (sc. oculorum), <hi rend="ital">for clearness of sight</hi> (label of an ointment box), <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4234</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8504.3" n="B" level="2"> Of objects affecting the hearing, <hi rend="ital">distinctness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clearness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">claritas in voce,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonituum chordarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">11: vocalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:131" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 131</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:41" default="NO">11, 3, 41</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8504.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n8504.5" n="A" level="2"> Intellectually, <hi rend="ital">clearness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinctness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perspicuity</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">pulchritudinem rerum claritas orationis illuminat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 16, 10</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 70</bibl>; Cod. Th. 1, 1, 6, § 1.—</sense><sense id="n8504.6" n="B" level="2"> Morally, <hi rend="ital">celebrity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">renown</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reputation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">splendor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">high estimation</hi> (so most freq.; several times in Cicero, who never uses claritudo, while in Sallust only claritudo is found, q. v.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also amplitudo, splendor, nobilitas, gloria): num te fortunae tuae, num amplitudinis, num claritatis, num gloriae poenitebat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:13:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 13, 38</bibl></cit>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:31:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 31, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae ex multis pro tuā claritate audiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:68:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 68, 1</bibl></cit>, cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">viri claritate praestantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nominis, Auct. B. Afr. 22: generis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 11, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:11" default="NO">3, 7, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">natalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">personarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Herculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vino Maroneo antiquissima claritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 4, 6, § 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 4, 5, § 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbarum (i.e. nobiliores herbae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 19, 120, § 188</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">claritates operum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 8, 34, § 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingeniorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 13, 77, § 201</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n8505" type="main" key="Cla_ri^tas2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clārĭtas Jūlia</orth>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n8505.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name given to the town Attuli</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in</hi> Hispania Baetica, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 1, 3, § 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
claritudo: <entryFree id="n8506" type="main" key="cla_ri^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clārĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>clarus</etym>, <sense id="n8506.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">clearness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brightness</hi> (access. form of claritas; in lit. signif. very rare; trop. in Sall. a few times, in Tac. very freq., but not in Cic., Cæs., Quint., or Suet.). </sense><sense id="n8506.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n8506.2" n="A" level="2"> Of objects affecting the sight: <cit><quote lang="la">fulgor et claritudo deae (sc. lunae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 28</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 9, 12</bibl>.— * </sense><sense id="n8506.3" n="B" level="2"> Of objects affecting the hearing: <cit><quote lang="la">vocis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:5:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 5, 1</bibl></cit> Hertz.—</sense><sense id="n8506.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (cf. claritas, II. B.), <hi rend="ital">renown</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">splendor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reputation</hi>: inclitissima, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:7:19" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 7, 19</bibl>; Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 82, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">artes animi, quibus summa claritudo paratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J 2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tantam claritudinem pervenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eminere claritudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:130:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 130, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 2</bibl></cit>: principis, id <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 16, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">materni generis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 43</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studiorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nominis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 71</bibl></cit> al.</sense></entryFree>
claritus: <entryFree id="n8507" type="gloss" key="cla_ri^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clārĭtus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, = clare (a form like, antiquitus, divinitus, humanitus, etc.), acc. to Cels. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 190</bibl> P.</entryFree>
clarius: <entryFree id="n8508" type="main" key="Cla_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Claros, II.</entryFree>
clarividus: <entryFree id="n8509" type="hapax" key="cla_ri^vi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clārĭvĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>clare-video</etym>, <sense id="n8509.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">seeing clearly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clear-sighted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
claro: <entryFree id="n8510" type="main" key="cla_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clāro</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>clarus</etym>, <sense id="n8510.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make bright</hi> or <hi rend="ital">clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to illuminate</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and very rare). </sense><sense id="n8510.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: Juppiter excelsā clarabat sceptra columnā, <hi rend="ital">showed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhibited</hi>, Cic. poët. Div 1, 12, 21: <cit><quote lang="la">aestatis primordia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arat. 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter longae limite flammae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:286" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 286</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8510.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n8510.3" n="A" level="2"> Mentally, <hi rend="ital">to make clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">evident</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to explain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">illustrate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set forth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animae naturam versibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:778" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 778</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obscura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 51, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8510.4" n="B" level="2"> Morally, <hi rend="ital">to make illustrious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to render famous</hi>: illum non labor Isthmius Clarabit pugilem, * Hor C. 4, 3, 4.</sense></entryFree>
claror: <entryFree id="n8511" type="hapax" key="cla_ror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clāror</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n8511.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">clearness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brightness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 112</bibl>; Ritschl ex conj. Camerar. dub.</sense></entryFree>
claros: <entryFree id="n8512" type="main" key="Cla^ro^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clărŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kla/ros</foreign>, <sense id="n8512.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small town in Ionia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Colophon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated for a temple and an oracle of Apollo</hi>, now the village <hi rend="ital">Zilleh</hi>, Ov M. 1, 516; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 54</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n8512.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Clărĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Claros</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Clarian.</hi> </sense><sense id="n8512.2" n="A" level="2"> As an epithet of Apollo: <cit><quote lang="la">Clarii Apollinis fanum, specus, oraculum, simulacrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:17:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 17, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:232" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 232</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 54</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:413" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 11, 413</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 20</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Clărĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Apollo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:360" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 360</bibl> Serv.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:199" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 199</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8512.3" n="B" level="2"> As an epithet of the poet Antimachus. of Colophon (prob. since claros was near Colophon, and, as devoted to Apollo, it appeared a suitable appel. of a poet), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:6:1" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 6, 1</bibl> Jahn (but in <cb n="CLAR" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:51:191" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 51, 191</bibl>, the best read. is: Antimachum, clarum poëtam).</sense></entryFree>
clarus: <entryFree id="n8513" type="main" key="cla_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clārus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>kindr. with Germ. klar; Engl. clear; cf. clamo</etym>, <sense id="n8513.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bright</hi> (opp. obscurus, caecus; very freq. in all periods, and in all kinds of composition). </sense><sense id="n8513.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n8513.2" n="A" level="2"> Relating to the sight, <hi rend="ital">clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bright</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brilliant</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n8513.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">luce clarā et candidā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut mulierum famam multorum oculis lux clara custodiat,</quote> <trans><tr>open day</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:15:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 15, 37</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">frequentissimā celebritate et clarissimā luce laetari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:20:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 20, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculorum lumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:825" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 825</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mundi lumina (i.e. sol et luna),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incendia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:569" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 569</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucerna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scintillae ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis splendor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1258" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1258</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">color clarissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:830" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 830</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">candor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:232" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 232</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:779 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 779 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pater omnipotens clarus intonat,</quote> <trans><tr>in the clear sky</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 141</bibl></cit> Serv.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:8:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 8, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clarissimae gemmae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:27:section=62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 27, § 62</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">lapides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:13:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 13, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:355" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 355</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">purpurarum sidere clarior usus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 1, 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8513.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">speculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 112</bibl></cit> dub.: <cit><quote lang="la">argento clari delphines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:673" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 673</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rutilis squamis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrugine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:582" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 9, 582</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 772</bibl> Wagn.: <cit><quote lang="la">auro gemmisque corona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:704" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 704</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 359</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">albo Lucifer exit Clarus equo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:190" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">claraeque coruscis Fulguribus taedae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:295 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 295 al.</bibl></cit> —* </sense><sense id="n8513.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of the wind (cf.: albus, candidus, and in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">lampro\s a)/nemos</foreign>; v. Lidd. and Scott under <foreign lang="greek">lampro/s</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">making clear</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">bringing fair weather</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquilo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:460" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 460</bibl></cit> Forbig. ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n8513.6" n="B" level="2"> Relating to the hearing, <hi rend="ital">clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinct</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clarā voce vocare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:711" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 711</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:48:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 48, 134</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 8, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:31:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 31, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:25:12" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 25, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:703" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 703</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clariore voce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 30</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:7:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 7, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:567" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 567</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plausus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:Grex. 6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. Grex. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plangor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:806" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 806</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:625" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 625</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">strepitus, Suet. Vit. Luc.: vox (opp. obtusa),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:136" default="NO">9, 4, 136</bibl> Spald.: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 55</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 41</bibl> and 82: <cit><quote lang="la">syllabae clariores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8513.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n8513.8" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manifest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">evident</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intelligible</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">planus, apertus, perspicuus, dilucidus, etc.): vide ut mi haec certa et clara attuleris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 4, 1</bibl></cit> Ruhnk.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia non properanti clara certaque erunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:39:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 39, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clara res est, quam dicturus sum, totā Siciliā celeberrima atque notissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:25:section=61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 25, § 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 38, § 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:32:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 32, 78</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">luce sunt clariora nobis tua consilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id quod est luce clarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:37:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 37, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ea, quae dixi, sole ipso inlustriora et clariora sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:21:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 21, 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 3, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caecis hoc satis clarum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:7:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumen eloquentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 8, 65</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:75" default="NO">11, 1, 75</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in narrando (T. Livius) clarissimi candoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:101" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 101</bibl></cit> Spald. and Frotsch.: <cit><quote lang="la">Massinissam regem post LXXXVI. annum generasse filium clarum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 14, 12, § 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somno clarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:28" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exempla,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">documenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 22</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n8513.9" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Brilliant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">renowned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">illustrious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honorable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">famous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glorious</hi>, etc. (cf.: illustris, insignis, eximius, egregius, praestans, nobilis; a favorite epithet, esp. in the <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>, like fortissimus, designating the highest praise of the honor-loving Roman; hence, a standing <hi rend="ital">title</hi>, at all times, <hi rend="ital">of distinguished public characters</hi>, as <hi rend="ital">consuls</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proconsuls</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pontifices</hi>, <hi rend="ital">senators</hi>, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">nobilitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 2, 28</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. to obscurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:639" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 639</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 26</bibl>: clari viri atque magni, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:27:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 27, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:69:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 69, 144</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">certe non tulit ullos haec civitas aut gloriā clariores, aut auctoritate graviores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:37:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 37, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir fortissimus et clarissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:15:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 15, 44</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 58</bibl>, § 153; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:45:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 45, 198</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:48:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 48, 134</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exempla clara et inlustria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:3:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugna clara et commemorabilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pax clarior majorque quam bellum fuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:37:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 37, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus abunde pollens potensque et clarus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">facundia clara pollensque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 30:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 30, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clara et magnifica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clari potentesque fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 38:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 38, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">familia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 76</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">majores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 61</bibl></cit>: pater si in Equestri gradu clarus, clarior vitricus, Plin. <pb n="350" /> <cb n="CLAS" /> Ep. 2, 13, 4: <cit><quote lang="la">clarissimi consules,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 33, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">generis clarissimus auctor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:9:19" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 9, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clarissima civitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Thras. 2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Thras. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud Germanicos quoque (Titus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scriptores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8513.10" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">clariores gloriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:37:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 37, 154</bibl></cit>; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">supra</ref></xr>: <cit><quote lang="la">arte medicinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:64" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquendi suavitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter giganteo triumpho,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agendis causis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ajax toties servatis Achivis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens memoriā nominis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cluvius Rufus eloquentiā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 43</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n8513.11" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in arte tibiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:3:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">clarissimi in eā scientiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in litteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in agendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in foro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in contionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:49" default="NO">12, 10, 49</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n8513.12" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex doctrinā nobilis et clarus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 9, 23</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">ob</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ob obscuram linguam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:639" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 639</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ob id factum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 32</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs clara ob insignem munimento naturali locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:39:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 39, 8</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Trojanoque a sanguine clarus Acestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:550" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 550</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">artis ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 1, 4, § 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8513.13" n="2" level="3"> As a title: <cit><quote lang="la">clarissimus vir,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 20, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 11, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">clarissimi consules,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:33:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 33, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:14:18" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 14, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Elag. 4</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Alex. Sev. 21 al.: permitto tibi vir clarissime Veiento (a senator), dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:13:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 13, 19</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ordo = senatorius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. also <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 9, 4, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8513.14" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, of the wives of such distinguished public characters: <cit><quote lang="la">clarissimae feminae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:9:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 9, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8513.15" n="c" level="4"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">notorious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">minus clarum putavit fore quod de armario quam quod de sacrario esset ablatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:12:section=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 12, § 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 19, § 50</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 12, § 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecquid hoc totā Siciliā clarius, ecquid indignius? etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 7</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">16: populus (sc. Campanus), luxuriā superbiāque clarus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:31:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 31, 6</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">clārē</orth> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n8513.16" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n8513.17" n="1" level="3"> Of sight (acc. to I. A.), <hi rend="ital">brightly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clearly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clare oculis video,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clare fulgens caesaries,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 66, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occidere,</quote> <trans><tr>of a star</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:52" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 52</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clarius micare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 20, 22, § 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nitere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:1:4" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 1, 4</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clarissime lucere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8513.18" n="2" level="3"> Of hearing (acc. to I. B.), <hi rend="ital">clearly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinctly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plainly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aloud</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clare recitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 30</bibl></cit>: plaudite, id. Am. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; cf. id. Bacch. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dic,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 4, 15</bibl></cit> Ruhnk.: <cit><quote lang="la">gemere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 20, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res clare enuntiare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:62" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exscreare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:160" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maledicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 14</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">palam et clare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:92:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 92, 5</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clarius fabulari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 22</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pisces clarissime audiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 70, 89, § 193</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 3</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n8513.19" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n8513.20" n="1" level="3"> Mentally (acc. to II. A.), <hi rend="ital">distinctly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intelligibly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clearly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clare atque evidenter ostendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:86" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 86</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid intellegere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 6, § 16</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: eo clarius id periculum apparet, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 14, 2</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">clarius intellegi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clarius elucebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clarius ostendemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:25 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 17, 25 al.</bibl></cit>— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8513.21" n="2" level="3"> Morally (acc. to II. B.), <hi rend="ital">illustriously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honorably</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">clarius exsplendescebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 1, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
classiarius: <entryFree id="n8514" type="main" key="classi^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">classĭārĭus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">i</orth>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>classis, 1. B. 2.</etym>, <sense id="n8514.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to the navy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">centurio,</quote> <trans><tr>a captain of a ship</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3617</bibl>. —More freq. as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">classĭārĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">marines</hi>, <hi rend="ital">naval forces</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Them. 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:62" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oth. 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
classicula: <entryFree id="n8515" type="hapax" key="classi^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">classĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n8515.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little fleet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flotilla</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 2, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
classicum: <entryFree id="n8516" type="main" key="classi^cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">classĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. classicus, II. B. 1.</entryFree>
classicus: <entryFree id="n8517" type="main" key="classi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">classĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>classis</etym>, <sense id="n8517.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a classis.</hi> </sense><sense id="n8517.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To a class</hi> or <hi rend="ital">division of the Roman people;</hi> only transf., <hi rend="ital">belonging to the first class</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of the highest class</hi>: classici dicebantur non omnes qui in quinque classibus erant, sed primi tantum classis homines (opp. classem, infra), Cat. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6</bibl> (7), 13, 1; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=113:12" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 113, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">testes classici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> p. 56, 15.—</sense><sense id="n8517.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">of the highest rank</hi>, <hi rend="ital">classical</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superior</hi>, <hi rend="ital">standard</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">classicus adsiduusque aliquis scriptor, non proletarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:8:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 8, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8517.3" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">classĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">he that summons the classes of citizens to the Comitia</hi>: in Arce <cb n="CLAT" /> classicus oanat tum circumque moeros, Comment. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=92" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 92</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n8517.4" n="II" level="1"> To the military and naval forces (v. infra; and cf. classis, I. B.), but in use only in the sense <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the fleet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">classicos milites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:61:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 61, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:48:12" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 48, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella,</quote> <trans><tr>naval</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:28" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:85:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 85, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corona = navalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:81:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 81, 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n8517.5" n="B" level="2"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n8517.6" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">classĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a field</hi> or <hi rend="ital">battle-signal upon the trumpet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">classicum cecinit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:27:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 27, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classicum canere jubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 32</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">classicum cani jubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classico ad contionem convocat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:36:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 36, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum silentium classico fecisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:45:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 45, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classica sonant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:637" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 637</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque excitatur classico miles truci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:5" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:11:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 11, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:186 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 186 al.</bibl>— <cit><quote lang="la">Since only the leader commanded it to be given: classicum praetorium (al. praeconium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 3, 41; cf. Caes. l. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:27:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 27, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 22</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8517.7" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the war-trumpet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">necdum etiam audierant inflari classica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:539" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 539</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:4" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 4</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n8517.8" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">classĭci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">marines</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 17</bibl>; 2, 22; 2, 67; 3, 55.—Also <hi rend="ital">mariners</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seamen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 3, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
classis: <entryFree id="n8518" type="main" key="classis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">classis</orth> (old orthog. CLASIS, Column. Rostr.; v. under I. B. 2.), is (<sense id="n8518.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">acc. sing.</hi> usu. classem; classim, Auct. B. Afr. 9, 2; <case>abl.</case> usu. classe; <cit><quote lang="la">classi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:41:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 41, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:79" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 79</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root cal-, cla-, of clamo, <foreign lang="greek">kale/w</foreign>; prop. the people as assembled or called together</etym>, hence, </sense><sense id="n8518.1" n="I" level="1"> After the division of the Roman people by Servius Tullius into six (or, the citizens who paid tribute alone being reckoned, into five) classes, </sense><sense id="n8518.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A class</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:42:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 42, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:43:2" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 43, 2</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:22:39 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 22, 39 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6</bibl> (7), 13, 1 sq.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 7, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:42:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 42, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:43:1" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 43, 1</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 13, § 43</bibl>; cf. Dion. Halic. 4, 16 sq.; <cit><quote lang="la">7, 59: prima classis vocatur... tum secunda classis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:33:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 33, 82</bibl></cit>: infra classem; v. classicus, I.—</sense><sense id="n8518.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (philosophi) mihi cum illo collati, quintae classis videntur,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>of the lowest rank</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 23, 73</bibl></cit>; cf. classicus, I. B.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n8518.4" n="B" level="2"> In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">the whole body of the citizens called to arms</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an army.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">1</orth> Of <hi rend="ital">the land army</hi> (mostly very ancient): procincta, Lex Numae in Fest. s. v. opima, p. 189, 13 Müll.: classis procincta [id est exercitus armatus, Gloss.], Fab. Pictor. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:15:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 15, 4</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:11:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 11, 3</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=56:3" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 56, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">classi quoque ad Fidenas pugnatum cum Vejentibus quidam in annales rettulere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:34:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 34, 6</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Hortinae classes populique Latini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:716" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 716</bibl></cit> Serv.—</sense><sense id="n8518.5" n="2" level="3"> Of men at sea, <hi rend="ital">the fleet</hi>, including the troops in it (the usu. signif. in prose and poetry): <cit><quote lang="la">CLASESQVE. NAVALES. PRIMOS. ORNAVET.... CLASEIS. POENICAS...., Column. Rostr., v. 7 sq.: nomina in classem dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:45:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 45, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera classis... fugerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:26:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 26, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut classem duceret in Ligurum oram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:26:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 26, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:24:13" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 24, 13</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:48:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 48, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">navium classis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:37:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 37, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">posteaquam maximas aedificasset ornassetque classes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classem instruere atque ornare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:51:section=135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 51, § 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classis ornandae reficiendaeque causā, Liv 9, 30, 4: comparare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 14, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:42 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 42 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classe navigare,</quote> <trans><tr>by ship</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 14, 32</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:379" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 379</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 11</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Hor.C. 3, 11, 48: classes = naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">geminasque legit de classe biremis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omittere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 794</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 299</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 255</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">efficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Suiones) praeter viros armaque classibus valent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 44</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n8518.6" n="II" level="1"> In the post-Aug. per., sometimes, <hi rend="ital">a class</hi>, <hi rend="ital">division</hi>, in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">pueros in classes distribuerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 23</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 2, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:21" default="NO">10, 5, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:46" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">operarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:9:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 74, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
clastidium: <entryFree id="n8519" type="main" key="Clasti^di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clastĭdĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n8519.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A fortress in</hi> Gallia Cisalpina, <hi rend="ital">near the Padus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Chiasteggio</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:22:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 22, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:48:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 48, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8519.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a fragment of Nœvius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:107" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:9:78" default="NO">9, 78</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
claterna: <entryFree id="n8520" type="main" key="Claterna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Claterna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n8520.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fortress in</hi> Gallia Cisalpina, <hi rend="ital">near Bononia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the river Guaderna</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 8, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 15, 20, § 116</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
clathri: <entryFree id="n8521" type="greek" key="cla_thri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clāthri</orth> (in MSS. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">clātri</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">clātra</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, corresp. to the Greek, prob. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 5, 74), = <foreign lang="greek">klh|qpa ta/</foreign>, <sense id="n8521.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lattice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grate</hi> (esp. to the cages of animals), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 17, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:473" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 473</bibl>; <cb n="CLAU" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 7, 7, § 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> III. Cons. Stil. 272</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3299</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
clathro: <entryFree id="n8522" type="main" key="cla_thro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clāthro</orth> (in MSS. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">clātro</orth>), no <sense id="n8522.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>clathri</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to furnish with a grate</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lattice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to set with bars</hi> (very rare), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:1:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 207, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
claudaster: <entryFree id="n8523" type="main" key="claudaster"><orth extent="full" lang="la">claudaster</orth>, <itype>tri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n8523.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little lame</hi>, Gloss.</sense></entryFree>
claudeo: <entryFree id="n8524" type="main" key="claudeo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">claudeo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">claudo</orth>, no <sense id="n8524.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>sum, ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>claudus, ground form of the more common claudico</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to limp</hi> or <hi rend="ital">halt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be lame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to falter</hi> (mostly trop.). </sense><sense id="n8524.1" n="(a)" level="5"> Claudeo: an ubi vos sitis, ibi consilium claudeat, Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 889</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n8524.2" n="(b)" level="5"> Claudo: neque ignorantia res claudit, Sall. ap. Don. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 84</bibl> (<bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 61, 25</bibl> Dietsch): conjuratione claudit, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 889</bibl> P. (<bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 80</bibl> ib.): <cit><quote lang="la">claudat amor erga te meus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. p. 122" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. p. 122</bibl></cit> Nieb. —</sense><sense id="n8524.3" n="(g)" level="5"> Of dub. form (yet it may be supposed that the passages in Cic. belong to claudeo as the regular form; cf. albeo = albico, candeo = candico, etc.; <cit><quote lang="la">while the passages in Sall. infra belong to claudo): beatam vitam, etiam si ex aliquā parte clauderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:8:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 8, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est cur claudere aut insistere orationem malint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:51:170" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 51, 170</bibl></cit> Meyer <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quācumque enim unā (parte) plane clauderet, orator esse non posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:59:214" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 59, 214</bibl></cit>: nihil socordia claudebat, Sall. Fragm. ap. Don. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 84</bibl>; and <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 39</bibl> (id. H. inc. 107 Dietsch): <cit><quote lang="la">si alterā parte claudet respublica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:39:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 39, 3</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:7:20" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 7, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:20:10" default="NO">13, 20, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 18, p. 359</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Deo Socr. 17, p. 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 1:27" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 1, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
claudia: <entryFree id="n8525" type="main" key="Claudi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Claudĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n8525.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Roman female name;</hi> v. Claudius.—</sense><sense id="n8525.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town of Noricum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 24, 27, § 146</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
claudialis: <entryFree id="n8526" type="main" key="Claudi^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Claudĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Claudius</etym>, <sense id="n8526.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to the emperor Claudius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Claudian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flaminium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3044 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
claudianus: <entryFree id="n8527" type="main" key="Claudi^a_nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Claudĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Claudius, II. B.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n8528" type="main" key="Claudi^a_nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Claudĭānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Claudius</etym>, <sense id="n8528.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman poet of Alexandria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of the time of Theodosius the Great and his sons</hi>, <hi rend="ital">several of whose panegyric poems are extant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 9:13" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 9, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
claudicatio: <entryFree id="n8529" type="main" key="claudi^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">claudĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>claudico</etym>, <sense id="n8529.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a limping</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:30:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 30, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:61:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 61, 249</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:12:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 12, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:11" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 11</bibl>, ext. 3.</sense></entryFree>
claudico: <entryFree id="n8530" type="main" key="claudi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">claudĭco</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">clōdĭco</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:61:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 61, 249</bibl>, like Claudius and Clodius, codex and caudex, etc., v. au), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>claudeo; like albico, candico from albeo, candeo</etym>, <sense id="n8530.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to limp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">halt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be lame</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n8530.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">Carvilio graviter claudicanti ex vulnere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:61:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 61, 249</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:758" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 758</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:12:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 12, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:80" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 80</bibl>;
