<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:2:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 6, 2, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8530.2" n="B" level="2"> In Lucretius, meton., of other irregular or unbalanced motions, <hi rend="ital">to waver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wabble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">halt;</hi> of the lame wings of birds, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:834" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 834</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the wavering of balances or scales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:515" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 515</bibl></cit>; and of the earth's axis, id: 6, 1107.—</sense><sense id="n8530.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to halt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">waver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be wanting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incomplete</hi> or <hi rend="ital">defective</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">claudicat ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:453" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 453</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tota res vacillat et claudicat, Cic. N. D, 1, 38, 107: vereri ne tota amicitia quasi claudicare videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:Fin. 1:20:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 20, 69</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:Brut. 63:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Brut. 63, 227</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:39:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 39, 3</bibl> (al. leg. claudo); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:2:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:2:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 6, 2, 5</bibl> and 6: <cit><quote lang="la">ut constare possimus nobismet ipsis nec in ullo officio claudicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:33:119" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 33, 119</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in comoediā, claudicamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:99" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 99</bibl></cit>.—So of discourse: <cit><quote lang="la">ne sermo in aequalitate horum omnium sicut pedum claudicet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid in nostrā oratione claudicat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:51:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 51, 198</bibl></cit>.—And once of the measure of a verse: claudicat hic versus; <cit><quote lang="la">haec, inquit, syllaba nutat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Epigr. 79, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
claudigo: <entryFree id="n8531" type="hapax" key="claudi_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">claudīgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>claudus</etym>, <sense id="n8531.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lameness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">limping</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> A. Veter. 1, 26, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
claudiopolis: <entryFree id="n8532" type="main" key="Claudi^o^po^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Claudĭŏpŏlis</orth>, is; <case>acc.</case> im; <case>abl.</case> <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n8532.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in Southern Cappadocia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Eraklia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 24, 20, § 85</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 8, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8532.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in Bithynia</hi>, prob. the mod. <hi rend="ital">Boli</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Bula</hi>, Cod. Th. 12, 1, 119.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Claudĭŏpŏlītāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Claudiopolis in Bithynia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 39</bibl> (48), 5; Traj. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 10, 40</bibl> (49), 3.</sense></entryFree>
clauditas: <entryFree id="n8533" type="main" key="claudi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">claudĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>claudus</etym>, <sense id="n8533.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lameness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">limping</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 43, 68, § 169</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:35" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 4, 7, § 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 16</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 6, § 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
claudius: <entryFree id="n8534" type="main" key="Claudi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Claudĭus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Clōdĭus</orth>, <itype>like claudo and clodo, codex and caudex, plostrum and plaustrum</itype>,<pb n="351" /> <cb n="CLAU" />  etc.), <orth extent="full" lang="la">Claudĭa</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Clōdĭa</orth>, <sense id="n8534.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of two very celebrated Roman</hi> gentes (one patrician, the other plebeian; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 1</bibl> and 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:708" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 708</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 16, 4</bibl>). </sense><sense id="n8534.1" n="A" level="2"> Claudius; so, </sense><sense id="n8534.2" n="1" level="3"> App. Claudius Caecus (v. Appius).—</sense><sense id="n8534.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The historian</hi> Q. Claudius Quadrigarius, <hi rend="ital">a contemporary of Sulla and Sisenna</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:9:6" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 9, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:7:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 7, 9</bibl>.—Called simply Claudius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:19:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 19, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 5, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8534.4" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The emperor</hi> Claudius; <cit><quote lang="la">in full, Tiberius Claudius Drusus Nero Germanicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 1</bibl></cit> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 1</bibl> sqq.—</sense><sense id="n8534.5" n="4" level="3"> In <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Claudĭa</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a female of the</hi> gens Claudia.—</sense><sense id="n8534.6" n="B" level="2"> Clodius. Thus <hi rend="ital">the restless tribune of the people</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and enemy of Cicero</hi>, P. Clodius Pulcher, <hi rend="ital">who was killed by Milo;</hi> v. Cic. Mil.—</sense><sense id="n8534.7" n="II" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n8534.8" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Claudĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Clōd-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">Claudian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Clodian</hi>: Via Claudia (Clodia), <hi rend="ital">a branch of the</hi> Via Cassia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:8:44" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 8, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 11" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 11</bibl>.—Aqua Claudia, <hi rend="ital">an aqueduct begun by the emperor Caligula</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and finished by the emperor Claudius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 13 sq" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 13 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 20</bibl> Bremi.—Tribus Claudia, <hi rend="ital">beyond the Anio</hi>, <hi rend="ital">named after the progenitor of the</hi> gens Claudia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 16, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:708" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 708</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Serv. in h. l.—Leges Clodiae,</quote> <trans><tr>proceeding from the tribune of the people</tr>, <tr>Clodius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 25</bibl></cit> and 26; cf. Orell. Ind. Leg. s. h. v.—</sense><sense id="n8534.9" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Claudĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a Claudius</hi> (esp. to the emperor of this name): <cit><quote lang="la">castra,</quote> <trans><tr>of App. Claudius Pulcher</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:31:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 31, 3</bibl></cit>: tonitrua, <hi rend="ital">named after the same</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=57:10" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 57, 10</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora,</quote> <trans><tr>of the emperor Claudius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 5, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cometa,</quote> <trans><tr>visible in his time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 7:21" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 7, 21</bibl></cit> and 29.—</sense><sense id="n8534.10" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Clōdĭ-ānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Clodius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the enemy of Cicero</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen,</quote> <trans><tr>his murder</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:27:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 27, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incendia,</quote> <trans><tr>caused by him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
claudo: <entryFree id="n8535" type="main" key="claudo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">claudo</orth> (* <orth extent="full" lang="la">clōdo</orth>: <sense id="n8535.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">clodunt ita (oculos),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:330" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 33, 76, § 330 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; but some refer clodo to claudeo; and more freq., although not in Cic., <orth extent="full" lang="la">clūdo</orth>, as always in the compounds; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <itype>si, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root sklu-, klu-, to shut; cf. <foreign lang="greek">klei/w, klei/s</foreign>, clavis; O. H. Germ. scliuzu; M. H. Germ. schliessen; also claudus, clavus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to shut.</hi> </sense><sense id="n8535.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To shut something that is open</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to close</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shut up</hi> (opp. aperire; freq. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n8535.2" n="(a)" level="5"> Claudo: <cit><quote lang="la">forem cubiculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:20:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 20, 59</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 25</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, clausae fores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:9:44" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 9, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:47" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conventus portus Varroni clausit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">januam serā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:6" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:7:36 sq" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 7, 36 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:6:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 6, 231</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 25, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 5, 23</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:27:section=68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 27, § 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes aditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 10, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:752" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 752</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rivos,</quote> <trans><tr>to dam up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad claudendas pupulas, ne quid incideret, et ad aperiendas, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:57:142" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 57, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ocellos (in dying),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl></cit> (3), 13, 17; so, <cit><quote lang="la">oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:746" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 746</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:503" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 503</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">clausis foribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:598" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 598</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8535.3" n="(b)" level="5"> Cludo: <cit><quote lang="la">domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Janum Quirinum ter clusit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:64" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animam clusit dolor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 59</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8535.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ita claudenda est res familiaris, ut eam benignitas aperire non possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:15:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 15, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus clausa contra cupiditatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:15:section=39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 15, § 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habere domum clausam pudori et sanctimoniae, patentem cupiditati et voluptatibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 30, 93</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 13, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures ad doctissimas voces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 8, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cludendae sunt aures malis vocibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 123:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 123, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horum ferocia vocem Euandri clausit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:45:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 45, 11</bibl></cit>: fugam hostibus, q. s. <hi rend="ital">to block up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cut off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prevent</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:18:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 18, 20</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:572" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 572</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:272" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 272</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:548" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 548</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alios incessus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sideritis sanguinem claudit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>stops</tr>, <tr>stanches</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 13, 83, § 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cluso corpore adversum vim veneni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clausa consilia habere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to conceal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:25:section=63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 25, § 63</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 10, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:641" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 641</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:846" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 846</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:140" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 140</bibl>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: animam laqueo, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to end one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s life</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:604" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 604</bibl> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vitalesque vias et respiramina clausit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:828" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 828</bibl></cit>).—</sense><sense id="n8535.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To close</hi>, <hi rend="ital">end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conclude</hi> (so, except the milit. expression, agmen, only <usg type="style">poet.</usg> or in post-Aug. prose; most freq. in Quint.). </sense><sense id="n8535.6" n="(a)" level="5"> Claudo: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus octavum trepidavit aetas Claudere lustrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 4, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:384" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 384</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labores ingentis belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:655" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 655</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:13:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 13, 165</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">20</bibl>, <cb n="CLAU" /> 242: <cit><quote lang="la">cenas lactucā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:14" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ventum est ad ipsum illud, quo veteres tragoediae comoediaeque clauduntur, Plaudite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 1, 52</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:27" default="NO">2, 15, 27</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8535.7" n="(b)" level="5"> Cludo: <cit><quote lang="la">cludere bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:58" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cludendi incohandique sententias ratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">opp. incipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 67</bibl></cit> (as claudere, opp. incipere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 8, 1</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">cum versus cluditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 65</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:71" default="NO">9, 4, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:73" default="NO">9, 4, 73</bibl>; 9, 4, 93; 9, 4, 102; 9, 4, 104; 9, 4, 105; 12, 10, 31.—</sense><sense id="n8535.8" n="2" level="3"> Agmen, in milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">to close the procession</hi> or <hi rend="ital">train</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bring up the rear</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:3:21" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 3, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:12:4" default="NO">4, 12, 4</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:590" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 590</bibl></cit>; cf. cogo, I. B. 3.—</sense><sense id="n8535.9" n="II" level="1"> (For the compounds includo, concludo.) Claudere aliquid aliquā re, <hi rend="ital">to shut up</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in something by something</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to enclose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encompass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surround</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imprison</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confine</hi> (class., esp. freq. in poetry and in the historians). </sense><sense id="n8535.10" n="(a)" level="5"> Claudo, with <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum aquā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:14:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (Syracusarum urbs) loci naturā terrā marique clauderetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:2:section=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 2, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(animae) clausae tenebris et carcere caeco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:734" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 734</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stabulis armenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:352" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 352</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">claudens textis cratibus pecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:45" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 45</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:554" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 554</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 646</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ensem vaginā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 245</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem Gyaro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">clausus domo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 53</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">intra domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rivus praealtis utrimque clausus ripis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:54:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 54, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:43:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 43, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:27:12" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 27, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">clauditur cubiculo aliquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 69</bibl></cit>; cf.: in atras et profundas tenebras eum claudebant, Tubero ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7</bibl> (6), 4, 3: <cit><quote lang="la">in arcā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">claudam in curiā vos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tectis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:697" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 697</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(apes) in arbore inani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:743" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 743</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquilonem in antris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 1, 262</bibl></cit>.—Without <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil se tam clausum posse habere, quod non istius cupiditati apertissimum esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:20:section=42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 20, § 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insula ea sinum ab alto claudit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:24:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 24, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:42" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:568 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 568 al.</bibl>—In milit. lang., of a hostile encompassing, <hi rend="ital">to encompass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">besiege</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blockade</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">praestare arbitrabatur, unum locum... quam omnia litora ac portus custodiā clausos teneri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem operibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:22:12 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 22, 12 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem obsidione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversarios locorum angustiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dat. 8, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Epam. 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,022:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ham. 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Milt. 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc Tusco claudimur amni,</quote> <trans><tr>are hemmed in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:473" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 473</bibl></cit>.—So of hunting: <cit><quote lang="la">nemorum saltus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indagine collis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:3:7" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvas vastasque feras indagine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:553" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 553</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">insidiis altas valles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:49" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 4, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur tibi clauduntur rete Imbelles capr eae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:371" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 371</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n8535.11" n="(b)" level="5"> Cludo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:3:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">venti clusi Nubibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 197</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:20:13" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 20, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8535.12" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">numcubi meam Benignitatem sensisti in te claudier?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nolo tibi ullum commodum in me claudier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 3, 3, 41</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">I. A. 2. supra.—Esp. of speech and rhythm: qui non claudunt numeris sententias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:68:229" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 68, 229</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">58, 198</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedibus verba,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to compose verses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 28</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod clausae hieme Alpes essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:36:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 36, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 317</bibl>: rura gelu tum claudit hiems (and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 111</bibl>: illos aspera ponti interclusit hiems).—Hence, <hi rend="ital">P.a.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">clausum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">clūsum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an enclosed place</hi> (for confining or keeping any thing): <cit><quote lang="la">clausa effringere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in clauso linquere,</quote> <trans><tr>in confinement</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:303" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 303</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructus clauso custodire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12</bibl></cit>, praef. § <cit><quote lang="la">3: sub uno clauso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:6:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clausa domorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:354" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 354</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clausa viarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:612" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 612</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n8536" type="main" key="claudo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">claudo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. claudeo.</entryFree>
claudus: <entryFree id="n8537" type="main" key="claudus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">claudus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">clūdus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 64</bibl>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">clōdus</orth>, Arat. Act. Apost. 266), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>root klu-; v. claudo; prop. shut in, hampered</etym>, <sense id="n8537.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">limping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">halting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lame.</hi> </sense><sense id="n8537.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">sutor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:30:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 30, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">claudus altero pede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 8, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars serpentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5</bibl></cit>. 278 al.—</sense><sense id="n8537.2" n="b" level="4"> Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">iste claudus, quemadmodum aiunt, pilam,</quote> <trans><tr>said of one who cannot make a right use of a thing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:28:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 28, 69</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8537.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">wavering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crippled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imperfect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defective</hi> (rare; mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): clauda navigia aplustris, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:436" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 436</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">claudae mutilataeque naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:24:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 24, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:9:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 9, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 24</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n8537.4" n="B" level="2"> Esp. of language: clauda carmina alterno versu, i. e. <hi rend="ital">elegies</hi> (since every second<cb n="CLAU" />  verse is a foot shorter than the preceding), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:1:11" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 1, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">clausulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:116" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 116</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 70</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8537.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Wavering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">untrustworthy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clauda pars officii tui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:1:86" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 1, 86</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">clauda fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:33" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 33</bibl></cit>.— No <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi></sense></entryFree>
clausala: <entryFree id="n8538" type="main" key="Clausala"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clausala</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n8538.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river of Illyria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the Khiri</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Drinossi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:31:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 31, 3</bibl> (al. Clausula).</sense></entryFree>
claustra: <entryFree id="n8539" type="main" key="claustra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">claustra</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">clostra</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 13, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">135, 2</bibl>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (in <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">claustrum</orth>, <itype>i, rare</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Caes.</author> Germ. Arat. 197</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:5:21" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 5, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:6:13" default="NO">7, 6, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 89, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:6:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:509" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 509</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, 10, p. 146 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">26, 8, 8</bibl>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">clostrum</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:21:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 21, 2</bibl>) [clausum, claudo], <sense id="n8539.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that by which any thing is shut up</hi> or <hi rend="ital">closed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a lock</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bolt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n8539.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: claves, claustra, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 545, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">claustra revellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:23:section=52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 23, § 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:21:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 21, 10</bibl>: januae pandere, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 76</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laxare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 259</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">relaxare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rumpere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:758" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 758</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diu claustris retentae ferae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:59:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 59, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferae claustris fractae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:81:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 81, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">claustra pati,</quote> <trans><tr>to submit to confinement</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 17, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discutere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reserare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:334" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 334</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portarum ingentia claustra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 185</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:53" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:28:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 28, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub signo claustrisque rei publicae positum vectigal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 7, 21</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n8539.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a bar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">band</hi>, <hi rend="ital">barrier</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bounds</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arta portarum naturae effringere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to disclose its secrets</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 72</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tua claustra fregerunt tui versus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>have become known</tr>, <tr>public</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudoris et reverentiae refringere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 2:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 14, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitaï claustra resolvere,</quote> <trans><tr>to loose the bands of life</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:416" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 416</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:397" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 397</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1152" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 1152</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:17:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 17, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(animus) amat spatiis obstantia rumpere claustra (the figure drawn from the bounds of a racecourse),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8539.3" n="II" level="1"> In a more extended sense, <hi rend="ital">a door</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gate that shuts up any place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a dam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dike;</hi> meton., <hi rend="ital">a place that is shut up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbis relinquant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 86</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Thebarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:474" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 474</bibl></cit>.—Of sunken ships, closing a port, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 14, 7</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi demersis navibus frenassent claustra maris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maris,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>a harbor</tr>, <tr>haven</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:442" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 442</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undae,</quote> <trans><tr>a dam</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 44</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Lucrino addita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 161</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Daedalea,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Labyrinth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 1166 al" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 1166 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n8539.4" n="B" level="2"> In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">a barricade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bulwark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">key</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fortress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bank</hi>, etc., for warding off an enemy: <cit><quote lang="la">claustra loci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:32:section=84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 32, § 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Corinthus in faucibus Graeciae, sic ut terra claustra locorum teneret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:32:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 32, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sutrium, quae urbs socia Romanis velut claustra Etruriae erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 32</bibl></cit>. 1: <cit><quote lang="la">Aegypti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 11, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tutissima praebet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42</bibl></cit>. 67, 6; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 9, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 7, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:61 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 61 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">montium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caspiarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 43</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:442" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 442</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 59</bibl>: suis claustris (<hi rend="ital">walls</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intrenchments</hi>) impeditos turbant, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 31</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">regni claustra Philae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:312" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 312</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Africae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:70" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 70</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8539.5" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ego claustra ista nobilitatis refregissem, ut aditus ad consulatum pateret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 8, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annonae Aegyptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
claustralis: <entryFree id="n8540" type="main" key="claustra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">claustrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n8540.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a fortress</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">munimen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 11, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
claustrarius: <entryFree id="n8541" type="main" key="claustra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">claustrārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>claustra</etym>, <sense id="n8541.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to locks</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">artifex,</quote> <trans><tr>a locksmith</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Elag. 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
claustritumus: <entryFree id="n8542" type="hapax" key="claustri^tu^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">claustrĭtŭmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>from claustrum, like aeditumus from aedes</etym>, <sense id="n8542.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a warden of locks</hi>, Laev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:105" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 105</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
claustrum: <entryFree id="n8543" type="main" key="claustrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">claustrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. claustra <sense id="n8543.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
clausula: <entryFree id="n8544" type="main" key="clausu^la1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clausŭla</orth>, ae. <gen>f.</gen> <etym>claudo</etym>. <sense id="n8544.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A close</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conclusion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">end</hi> (cf. claudo, I. B.; in good prose; <cit><quote lang="la">most freq. in Quint.): in quo (mimo) cum clausula non invenitur,</quote> <trans><tr>a fitting end</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:27:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 27, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum bonam clausulam inpone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 77:20" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 77, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:99" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 99</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:21:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 21, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">edicti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:14:section=35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 14, § 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clausulam inponere disputationi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:19:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 19, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peracti operis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:57:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 57, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summae nervorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 45, 101, § 247</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8544.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n8544.2" n="A" level="2"> In rhet., <hi rend="ital">the close of a period</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:59:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 59, 240</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 44, 173</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 46, 181</bibl>; 3, 50, 192; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:64:215 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 64, 215 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:77" default="NO">9, 3, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4" default="NO">9, 4</bibl>. 50; 9, 4, 70; 9, 4, 101; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. initiun,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 5, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:45" default="NO">9, 3, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:62" default="NO">9, 4, 62</bibl>; 9, 4, 67; <cit><quote lang="la">9, 4, 107 al.: et calx,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 5, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8544.3" n="B" level="2"> In jurid. Lat., <hi rend="ital">the</hi> <pb n="352" /> <cb n="CLAV" /> <hi rend="ital">conclusion of a legal formula</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:8:25" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 8, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:6:23" default="NO">4, 6, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:6:26" default="NO">4, 6, 26</bibl>; and hence in gen., <hi rend="ital">any clause</hi> or <hi rend="ital">section of a law</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:3:15" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3, 3, 15</bibl> pr.; 35, 3, 3 pr.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n8545" type="main" key="Clausu^la2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clausŭla</orth>, v. Clausala.</entryFree>
clausum: <entryFree id="n8546" type="main" key="clausum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clausum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. claudo <sense id="n8546.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
clausura: <entryFree id="n8547" type="main" key="clausu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clausūra</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">clūsūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>claudo</etym>. * <sense id="n8547.0" n="I" level="1"> (Cf. claustra, I. A.) <hi rend="ital">A lock</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bolt</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2510</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8547.1" n="II" level="1"> (Cf. claustra, II. B.) <hi rend="ital">A castle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fort</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 27, 2, § 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 2, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
clausus: <entryFree id="n8548" type="main" key="clausus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clausus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from claudo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n8549" type="main" key="Clausus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clausus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n8549.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Sabine proper name</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Attus Clausus, ancestor of the gens Claudia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 16, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 8, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:707" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 707</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:9 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 9 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
clava: <entryFree id="n8550" type="main" key="cla_va"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clāva</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root cel- of percello; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kla/w</foreign> and clades</etym>. <sense id="n8550.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A knotty branch</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a staff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cudgel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">club</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adfer duas clavas... probas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 5, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:968" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 968</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sternentes agmina clavā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:318" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 318</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:4:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:575" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 575</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:43:section=94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 43, § 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 1, 3, § 18</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">a bar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lever</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 13, 1</bibl>.—As a weapon for exercising, used by young men, and esp. by soldiers, <hi rend="ital">a foil</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:16:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 16, 58</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 1, 11</bibl>.—As a badge of Hercules, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5) 9, 39; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 117</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 9, 114</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 236</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:53" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 53</bibl>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=62" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 62</bibl> Müll.—Hence, prov., clavam Herculi extorquere, for an impossible undertaking, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 3</bibl>; Don. Vit. Verg.— Also Clava Herculis, <hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">otherwise called</hi> nymphea, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 33</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8550.1" n="II" level="1"> In the lang. of economy, <hi rend="ital">a graft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scion</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 10, 12</bibl> and 13; cf. clavula.</sense></entryFree>
clavarium: <entryFree id="n8551" type="hapax" key="cla_va_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clāvārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n8551.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">money given to soldiers for the purchase of shoe-nails</hi> (cf. calcearium), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 50 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
clavator: <entryFree id="n8552" type="hapax" key="cla_va_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clāvātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>clava</etym>, <sense id="n8552.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who carries clubs</hi> or <hi rend="ital">foils</hi>, <hi rend="ital">used in military exercises</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cudgel-bearer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 5, 25</bibl>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=62:9" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 62, 9</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
clavatus: <entryFree id="n8553" type="main" key="cla_va_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clāvātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. clavo.</entryFree>
clavicarius: <entryFree id="n8554" type="main" key="cla_vi^ca_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clāvĭcārĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>clavis</etym>, <sense id="n8554.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a locksmith</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 10, 64, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
clavicula: <entryFree id="n8555" type="main" key="cla_vi^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clāvĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym> * <sense id="n8555.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small key</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Caes.</author> Germ. Arat. 195</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8555.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A tendril</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by which the vine clings to its props</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:120" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 120</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:6:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23</bibl>, prooem. § 5.—</sense><sense id="n8555.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A bar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bolt of the door</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Grom. 55" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Grom. 55</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">clāvĭcŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a key-keeper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jailer</hi>, Firm. Math. 3, 66.</sense></entryFree>
claviger: <entryFree id="n8556" type="main" key="cla_vi^ger1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clāvĭger</orth>, <itype>gĕra, gĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n8556.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">clubbearing;</hi> as an epithet of Hercules [clavagero], <hi rend="ital">the club-bearer</hi> (v. clava, 1.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 284</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> F 1, 544</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 68</bibl>.—Also of the robber Periphetes: <cit><quote lang="la">clavigera proles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:437" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 437</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clavigerum numen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:14" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n8557" type="main" key="cla_vi^ger2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clāvĭger</orth>, <itype>gĕri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>clavis-gero</etym>, <sense id="n8557.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the key-bearer</hi>, an epithet of Janus, as the god of doors, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:228" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 228</bibl>; cf. Macr S. 1, 9.</sense></entryFree>
clavis: <entryFree id="n8558" type="main" key="cla_vis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clāvis</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">clāves</orth>, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1321,001:Comment. p. 459" default="NO"><author>Pompon.</author> Comment. p. 459</bibl>), <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<case>acc.</case> commonly clavem, clavim, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 1, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:4:31" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 4, 31</bibl>; cf. Paul ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=56" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 56</bibl> Müll.; <sense id="n8558.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">Don. p. 1750 P.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 101</bibl></cit> ib.; <case>abl.</case> clavi and clave: <cit><quote lang="la">clavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:22" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, 14, p. 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:8:1:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 8, 1, § 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 10, 252</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Charis. l. l.: clave,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:158" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 158</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, 20, p. 226</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:17:section=15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 17, § 15</bibl>; cf. Neue, Formenl. 1, 199) [root klu-, v. claudo], <hi rend="ital">a key</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clavim cedo, Plaut Most. 2, 1, 78: clavem abduxi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Cas. 5:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cas. 5, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis horreorum clavis tradidisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alias clavis portis imposuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:24:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 24, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unā portarum clave teneri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:158" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aptare claves foribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:47:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 47, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulterinae portarum,</quote> <trans><tr>false keys</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J 12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J 12, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">clavis adultera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:643" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 643</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub clavi esse,</quote> <trans><tr>to be shut up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:22" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Caecuba Servata centum clavibus, Hor C. 2, 14, 26: claves tradere, as an indication of the delivering up of the household (for possession or oversight),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:1:74" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 1, 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:77:section=21" default="NO">31, 77, § 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">claves adimere uxori,</quote> <trans><tr>to separate from her</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:28:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 28, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Laconica,</quote> <trans><tr>a peculiar key with several wards</tr>, <tr>used only for fastening from the outside</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 1, 57</bibl></cit> Lorenz ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n8558.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n8558.2" n="A" level="2"> Clavis trochi, <hi rend="ital">an instrument in the form of a key</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by which a top was set in motion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 14, 6.—* </sense><sense id="n8558.3" n="B" level="2"> Clavis torculari, <hi rend="ital">a lerer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bar</hi> (French, clef), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 13, 1</bibl> Schneid. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>, and Comm. p. 57. <cb n="CLAV" /></sense></entryFree>
clavo: <entryFree id="n8559" type="main" key="cla_vo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clāvo</orth>, no <sense id="n8559.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>clavus</etym> (rare; not ante-Aug.; mostly in <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>). </sense><sense id="n8559.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To furnish</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fasten with nails</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to nail</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> 21, 103</bibl>: clavata concha, i. e. <hi rend="ital">furnished with points</hi> or <hi rend="ital">prickles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 36, 61, § 130</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8559.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To furnish with a purple stripe</hi> (cf. clavus, II. D.): <cit><quote lang="la">mantilia cocco clavata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clavata auro tunica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Bonos. 15</bibl></cit>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=56:9" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 56, 9</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
clavula: <entryFree id="n8560" type="main" key="cla_vu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clāvŭla</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">clābŭla</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">clāvŏla</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>clava</etym>, <sense id="n8560.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a scion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">graft</hi>, Varr. R. R, 1, 40, 4; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 414, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
clavularis: <entryFree id="n8561" type="main" key="cla_vu^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clāvŭlāris</orth>, v. clabularis.</entryFree>
clavulus: <entryFree id="n8562" type="main" key="cla_vu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clāvŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>clavus</etym>. <sense id="n8562.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small nail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a tack</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 21, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:9:15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 9, 15</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n8562.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small swelling</hi> (cf. clavus, II. B.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
clavus:
<entryFree id="n8563" type="main" key="cla_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clāvus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>root klu-, v. claudo; prop. that which shuts or fastens</etym>. <sense id="n8563.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A nail</hi>, usually of metal. </sense><sense id="n8563.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">offerumentas habebis pluris Quam ulla navis longa clavos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(leges) ad parietem fixae clavis ferreis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 32</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">clavi ferrei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 3 al.</bibl>—Sometimes of hard wood: <cit><quote lang="la">clavis corneis occludere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornus... lignum utile, si quid cuneandum sit in ligno clavisve figendum ceu ferreis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 40, 76, § 206</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clavis religare tigna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clavos per modica intervalla figentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 20, 4</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Acc. to a Tuscan usage the ancient Romans designated the number of the year by nails, which the highest magistrate annually, at the Ides of September, drove into the wall of Jupiter's temple: clavo ab dictatore fixo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 3, 3</bibl></cit> sqq.; 8, 18, 12 sq.; 9, 28, 6: clavus annalis, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=56:10" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 56, 10</bibl> Müll.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">O. Müll. Etrusk. 2, p. 329 sq., and Dict. of Antiq. p. 263. Also, in a later age, country people seem to have kept an account of the years in this way,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 135, 8, 9</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: clavo clavum eicere, <hi rend="ital">to drive out one nail by another</hi> (Gr. <foreign lang="greek">h(/lw| to
 h(=lon, patta/lw| to
 pa/ttalon</foreign>, sc. <foreign lang="greek">dei= e)celau/nein</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">novo quidam amore veterem amorem tamquam clavo clavum eiciendum putant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:35:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 35, 75</bibl></cit>: aliquid trabali clavo figere, <hi rend="ital">to fasten with a large nail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to clinch</hi> a matter, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:21:section=53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 21, § 53</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, p. 51</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n8563.2" n="2" level="3"> As <hi rend="ital">a symbol of immovable firmness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Necessitas Clavos trabales Gestans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:35:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 35, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si figit adamantinos Necessitas Clavos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 24, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. O. Müll. as above cit., p. 331.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n8563.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex hoc die clavum anni movebis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>reckon the beginning of the year</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fixus animus clavo Cupidinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficium trabali clavo figere (v. trabalis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:21:section=53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 21, § 53</bibl></cit> Zumpt; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, p. 51</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8563.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> of objects of like form. </sense><sense id="n8563.5" n="A" level="2"> (<usg type="style">Lit.</usg> the handle of the rudder, the tiller; hence, pars pro toto.) <hi rend="ital">The rudder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">helm</hi>, in gen. (only <number>sing.</number>): ut clavum rectum teneam, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 2, 12</bibl> (Ann. v. 472 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">clavum ad litora torquere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 177</bibl></cit> Serv.; 10, 218.—</sense><sense id="n8563.6" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">clavum tanti imperii tenere et gubernacula rei publicae tractare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abicere,</quote> <trans><tr>to leave off the care of a thing</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 106</bibl></cit>: dum clavum rectum teneam, <hi rend="ital">if I keep a steady helm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">am not negligent</hi> (as in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">o)rqa
 ta
 nau=n</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 24</bibl> Spald.; cf. the passage of Enn. supra. —</sense><sense id="n8563.7" n="B" level="2"> In medic. lang., <hi rend="ital">a painful tumor</hi> or <hi rend="ital">excrescence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a wart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a corn;</hi> on the feet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 14</bibl>. clavis in pedibus mederi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 17, 71, § 184</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:101" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 23, 49, § 101</bibl> sq.; 26, 11, 66, § 106; 28, 16, 62, § 222; <cit><quote lang="la">on the eye,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 7, 12</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">in the nose,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 14, 77, § 126</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">upon the neck of cattle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:14:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 14, 6</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">in sheep,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 5, 11</bibl></cit>.—Also <hi rend="ital">a disease of the olive-tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 223</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8563.8" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of abortion of bees</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 16, 16, § 50</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8563.9" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A purple stripe on the</hi> tunica, which, for senators, was broad (latus, cf. laticlavius); for the equites, narrow (angustus; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">angusticlavius). In the time of the emperors, however, the sons of the senators and equites also, who were preparing for civil office, wore the latus clavus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 7, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=79" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 79</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:10:29" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 10, 29</bibl> Jahn; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 6, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:138" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 138</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:88:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 88, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl>: tunicam ita consuere, ut altera plagula sit angustis clavis, altera latis, Varr L. L. 9, § 47 Müll.—Hence the phrase: latum clavum ab Caesare impetravi,<cb n="CLEM" />  i. e. <hi rend="ital">I have become senator</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 9, 2</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">clavum alicui tribuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adimere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adipisci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 2</bibl></cit>.—Rarely <hi rend="ital">a purple stripe</hi> on bed or table cloths, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 8, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8563.10" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a tunic</hi>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">either wide</hi> or <hi rend="ital">narrow striped</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutare in horas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumere depositum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 6, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
claxendix: <entryFree id="n8564" type="main" key="claxendix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">claxendix</orth>, v. clacendix.</entryFree>
clazomenae: <entryFree id="n8565" type="main" key="Cla_zo^me^nae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clāzŏmĕnae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*klazomenai/</foreign>, <sense id="n8565.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town on the coast of Ionia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">upon a peninsula of the Bay of Smyrna</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Kelisman</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Vourla</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:17:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 17, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 31, § 117</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:43:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 43, 104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 7, 5</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n8565.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Clāzŏmĕnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Clazomenœ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Clazomenian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Anaxagoras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:34:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 34, 138</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 58, 59, § 149</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 7, 9, § 73</bibl></cit>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Clāzŏ-mĕnĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Clazomenœ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:39:9 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 39, 9 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
