clitor: <entryFree id="n8629" type="main" key="Cli_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clītor</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Clītŏrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n8629.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Arcadia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:35:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 35, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 6, 10, § 20</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Abl.</hi> Clitori, Nov. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 316, 5</bibl> (cf. Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2, p. 49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, p. 49</bibl>): Clitore, Liv. l. l.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Clītŏrĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um: <cit><quote lang="la">fons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:322" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 322</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 2, 13, § 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
clitumnus: <entryFree id="n8630" type="main" key="Cli_tumnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clītumnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n8630.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small river in Umbria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated in ancient times</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose source received divine homage as</hi> Juppiter Clitumnus, now <hi rend="ital">Clitunno</hi> or <hi rend="ital">la Vene</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 146</bibl> Serv. et Heyne; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl> (3), 19, 25; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:547" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 547</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:453" default="NO">8, 453</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 43</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Clītum-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Clitumnus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Clitumna novalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:4:128" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 4, 128</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
clitus: <entryFree id="n8631" type="main" key="Cli_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clītus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*klei=tos</foreign>, <sense id="n8631.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a friend of Alexander the Great</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who was killed by him in a fit of drunkenness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:37:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 37, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:1:9 al" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 1, 9 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
cliva: <entryFree id="n8632" type="main" key="cli_va"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clīva</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. clivus.</entryFree>
clivius: <entryFree id="n8633" type="gloss" key="clivius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clivius</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: auspicia, <sense id="n8633.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">which forbid any thing to be done</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=64:10" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 64, 10</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">avis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 14, 17, § 57</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
clivosus: <entryFree id="n8634" type="main" key="cli_vo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clīvōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>clivus</etym>, <sense id="n8634.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hilly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">full of hills</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steep</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> or in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">rus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trames,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loci et aridi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 4:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 4, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. planus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:R. R. 2:16:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. R. 2, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 24, 55, § 200</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Olympus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:415" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 415</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:14:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 14, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8634.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tramite vitae,</quote> <trans><tr>steep</tr>, <tr>difficult</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:120" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 120</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
clivulus: <entryFree id="n8635" type="main" key="cli_vu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clīvŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n8635.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little hill</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:37:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 37, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 144, 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
clivus: <entryFree id="n8636" type="main" key="cli_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clīvus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">clīva</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 195, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Limit. p. 43" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Limit. p. 43</bibl> Goes. dub.) [clino = <foreign lang="greek">kli/nw</foreign>, to incline], <sense id="n8636.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gently sloping height</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a declivity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slope</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an ascent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a hill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eminence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ascending road</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quā se subducere colles Incipiunt, mollique jugum demittere clivo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 293</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 151</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 191</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 118</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:32:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 32, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 13, 10</bibl> et saep.—As antithet. to a plain, with the epithet arduus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:264" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 264</bibl>: Clivus Capitolinus, <hi rend="ital">the higher road ascending to the Capitol</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a part of</hi> Sacra Via, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 18, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 1, 6, § 23</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called Clivus Sacer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 35</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Clivus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 44, 18</bibl>.— Prov., for <hi rend="ital">a great difficulty to be overcome</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clivo sudamus in imo,</quote> <trans><tr>we are but commencing our labor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 20, 41</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 394</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 47, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 31:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 31, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:605" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 605</bibl>. —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, for <hi rend="ital">any thing sloping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a slope</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unevenness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:663" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 663</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cloaca: <entryFree id="n8637" type="main" key="clo^a_ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clŏāca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. cluo = purgo; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">klu/zw</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n8637.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an artificial canal in Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">constructed by Tarquinius Priscus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by which the filth was carried from the streets into the Tiber;</hi> in gen., <hi rend="ital">a sewer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:35:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 35, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:13:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 13, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:242 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 242 al.</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:38:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 38, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:56:2" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 56, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:55:5" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 55, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:104 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 104 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 3, 30</bibl>; Dion. Halic. 3, 67; v. Dict. of Antiq. p. 269 sq. —</sense><sense id="n8637.1" n="B" level="2"> Humorously, <hi rend="ital">the stomach of a drunken woman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 29</bibl>; cf. intestini, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 209, 19</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n8637.2" n="C" level="2"> Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">arcem facere e cloacā,</quote> <trans><tr>much ado about nothing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:40:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 40, 95</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cloacalis: <entryFree id="n8638" type="main" key="clo^a_ca_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clŏācālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cloaca</etym>, <sense id="n8638.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to a</hi> cloaca (ante- and post-class.): flumen, Cato ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=59:18" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 59, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">faeculentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cloacare: <entryFree id="n8639" type="gloss" key="cloa_ca_re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cloācāre</orth> = inquinare, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=66:2" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 66, 2</bibl>; cf. cloaco, <foreign lang="greek">molu/nw</foreign>, Gloss. Labb.</entryFree>
cloacarium: <entryFree id="n8640" type="main" key="clo^a_ca_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clŏācārĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cloaca</etym>, <sense id="n8640.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the duty paid for conducting the private sewers into the public ones</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for maintaining and cleansing the sewers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:1:39:section=5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 30, 1, 39, § 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:27:section=3" default="NO">7, 1, 27, § 3</bibl>; cf. Becker, Antiq. II. 2, p. 121, n. 616.</sense></entryFree>
cloacina: <entryFree id="n8641" type="main" key="Clo^a_ci_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clŏācīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Cluacina.</entryFree>
cloacula: <entryFree id="n8642" type="main" key="clo^a_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clŏācŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>cloaca</etym>, <sense id="n8642.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small sewer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drain</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Elag. 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cloanthus: <entryFree id="n8643" type="main" key="Clo^anthus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clŏanthus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n8643.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a companion of Æneas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:222 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 222 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
clodia: <entryFree id="n8644" type="main" key="Clo_dia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clōdia</orth>, ae. <gen>f.</gen>, v. Claudius.</entryFree>
clodianus: <entryFree id="n8645" type="main" key="Clo_di^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clōdĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Claudius, II. B.</entryFree>
clodico: <entryFree id="n8646" type="main" key="clo_di^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clōdĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. claudico.</entryFree>
clodius: <entryFree id="n8647" type="main" key="Clo_di^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clōdĭus</orth>, v. Claudius. <pb n="355" /> <cb n="CLUN" /></entryFree>
clodo: <entryFree id="n8648" type="main" key="clo_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clōdo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. claudo.</entryFree>
clodus: <entryFree id="n8649" type="main" key="clo_dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clōdus</orth>, v. claudus.</entryFree>
cloelius: <entryFree id="n8650" type="main" key="Cloeli^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cloelĭus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Clŭĭlĭus</orth>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cloelĭa</orth>, <sense id="n8650.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Cluilius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:22:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 22, 4 al.</bibl></cit>—Esp.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cloelĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Roman maiden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">when a hostage to Porsenna</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with several companions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swam back to Rome</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 13, 6</bibl> and 7; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:651" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 651</bibl>; Piso ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:29 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 6, 13, § 29 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
clonius: <entryFree id="n8651" type="main" key="Clo^ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n8651.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of two companions of Æneas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:574" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 574</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 749</bibl>.* † <orth extent="full" lang="la">clōnŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">klw/n</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> batrachion or scelerata, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
clonus: <entryFree id="n8652" type="hapax" key="Clo^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clŏnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n8652.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated designer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:499" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 499</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
clostellum: <entryFree id="n8653" type="hapax" key="clo_stellum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clōstellum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>clostrum = claustrum</etym>, <sense id="n8653.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small lock</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 140, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
closter: <entryFree id="n8654" type="hapax" key="Clo_ste_r"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clōstēr</orth>, <itype>ēris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n8654.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Arachne</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inventor of the spindle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 196</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
clostrum: <entryFree id="n8655" type="main" key="clostrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clostrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. claustrum.</entryFree>
clotho: <entryFree id="n8656" type="main" key="Clo_tho_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clōthō</orth> (apparently used only in <case>nom.</case> and <case>acc.</case>), = <foreign lang="greek">*klwqw/</foreign>, <sense id="n8656.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the spinner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">among the three Parcœ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:757" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 757</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:241" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ib. 241</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:135" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 135</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:556" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 556</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8656.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> = vita, <hi rend="ital">life</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">longa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:404" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 404</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cluacina: <entryFree id="n8657" type="main" key="Clu^a_ci_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clŭācīna</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Clŏācīna</orth>, <itype>on account of a derivation from cloaca</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 20</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cluo</etym>, <sense id="n8657.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the purifier</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cluacina Venus, so called because the Romans, after the end of the Sabine war, purified themselves in the vicinity of her statue with myrtle branches,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 29, 36, § 119</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:48:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 48, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 1, 720</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 265</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 20, 11</bibl>; <number>plur.</number>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cludo: <entryFree id="n8658" type="main" key="clu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clūdo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. claudo.</entryFree>
cludus: <entryFree id="n8659" type="main" key="clu_dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clūdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. claudus.</entryFree>
cluens: <entryFree id="n8660" type="main" key="clu^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clŭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, v. cliens.</entryFree>
cluentius: <entryFree id="n8661" type="main" key="Clu^enti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clŭentĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n8661.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 1</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:78:270 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 78, 270 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:61" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 61</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 123</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
clueo: <entryFree id="n8662" type="main" key="clu^e^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clŭĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">clŭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Prof. 21</bibl>; Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=30" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 30</bibl> Müll.; Prud. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:585" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> 2, 585</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 1:1" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 571</bibl>), <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n8662.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [root klu-; Sanscr. s)ru, hear; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)kroa/omai, kle/os</foreign>; Lat. laus], like audio, 5., <hi rend="ital">to hear one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self called in some way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be named</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spoken of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reputed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">esteemed</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">famed in some way</hi>, = dicor (only ante- and post-class.; most freq. in Plaut. and Lucr., but not in Ter.; mostly in mock-heroic style; cf. Lorenz ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:v. 570" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. v. 570</bibl>); with <hi rend="ital">pred. nom.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut meus victor vir belli clueat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 36</bibl>.—With <case>abl.</case>, etc., <hi rend="ital">of manner</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Acherunti clueas gloriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 31</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 95</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corona, Per gentes Italas hominum quae clara clueret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quod agit, cluet victoriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cluentum fides Quojusmodi clueat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 4, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam quaecumque cluent,</quote> <trans><tr>every thing that has a name</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:450" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 450</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:481" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 481</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:581" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 581</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:351" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 351</bibl>; 2, 525; 2, 791; 3, 207 al.; Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:10:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 10, 23</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">pred. nom.</hi>: per gentes esse cluebat omnium miserrimus, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 88, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 53</bibl> Lachm. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> cf. also clueor.</sense></entryFree>
clueor: <entryFree id="n8663" type="main" key="clu^e^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clŭĕor</orth>, <itype>ēri, 2</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> (collat. form of clueo, q. v.), <sense id="n8663.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be named</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reputed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">esteemed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quippe ego te ni contemnam, Stratioticus homo qui cluear?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: sed hi cluentur hospitum infidissimi, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 88, 3</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 194 Rib.); Varr. ib.</sense></entryFree>
cluilius: <entryFree id="n8664" type="main" key="Clu^i^li^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clŭĭlĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kloi/lios</foreign>, <sense id="n8664.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of Alba</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 23, 4</bibl> and 7; <cit><quote lang="la">after whom the Cluiliae fossae were named,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 23, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:39:5" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 39, 5</bibl> (in Plut. Coriol. p. 227 <foreign lang="greek">*kloilei=ai ta/froi</foreign>).</sense></entryFree>
cluior: <entryFree id="n8665" type="gloss" key="cluior"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cluior</orth> <itype>nobilior</itype>, Gloss. Isid.; cf. praecluis.</entryFree>
clumae: <entryFree id="n8666" type="gloss" key="clu_mae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clūmae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>: folliculi hordei, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=55:13" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 55, 13</bibl> Müll.; cf. gluma.</entryFree>
clunaclus: <entryFree id="n8667" type="gloss" key="clu_na_clus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clūnāclus</orth> <itype>culter</itype>, <sense id="n8667.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the sacrificial knife</hi>: vel quia clunes hostiarum dividit, vel quia ad clunes dependet, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=50" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:6" default="NO">6</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 18, 6, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
clunae: <entryFree id="n8668" type="gloss" key="clu_nae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clūnae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n8668.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">apes;</hi> so called acc. to Fest., a clunibus tritis, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=55:9" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 55, 9</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
clunalis: <entryFree id="n8669" type="hapax" key="clu_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clūnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>clunis</etym>, <sense id="n8669.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to the hinder parts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hind-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. 361</bibl></cit>. <cb n="CLYM" /></sense></entryFree>
cluniculus: <entryFree id="n8670" type="hapax" key="clu_ni^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clūnĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-a</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>clunis</etym>, <sense id="n8670.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">small hinder-parts</hi>: avium, Favorin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:8:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 8, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
clunis: <entryFree id="n8671" type="main" key="clu_nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clūnis</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (mostly <sense id="n8671.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">plur.; acc.</hi> clunem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:21" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:334" default="NO">6, 334</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 19, 2</bibl>; <case>abl.</case> clune, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:164" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 164</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:47:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 47, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:100:3" default="NO">11, 100, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 50, 71, § 140</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:141" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 6, 39, § 141</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 23, 3</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> and <gen>f.</gen> (hence the grammarians vary in the designation of the gender; cf. Voss. Arist. 1, 29, p. 498; Rudd. 1, p. 25, n. 35) [Gr. <foreign lang="greek">klo/nis</foreign>; Sanscr. s)rōni: nates, clunes, Bopp, Gloss. 358 a; cf. 1. cluo], <hi rend="ital">a buttock</hi>, <hi rend="ital">haunch.</hi> </sense><sense id="n8671.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Masc.</hi>, Plaut. Fragm. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=61:17" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 61, 17</bibl> Müll.; and in <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 197, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:164" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 164</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:100:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 100, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8671.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 8, 8, § 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:141" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 6, 39, § 141</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n8671.3" n="(g)" level="5"> Dub., * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1266" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1266</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 50</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 8, 91</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 5, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:19" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 5, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:7:2" default="NO">8, 7, 2</bibl>: <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 21, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">23, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:21" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:167" default="NO">5, 167</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:334" default="NO">6, 334</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 50, 71, § 140</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:47:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 47, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 208</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, p. 239</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cluo: <entryFree id="n8672" type="gloss" key="clu^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clŭo</orth> = purgo, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 29, 36, § 119</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 1, 720</bibl> (where, instead of pugnare, purgare should be read).</entryFree>
<entryFree id="n8673" type="main" key="clu^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clŭo</orth> = clueo, q. v.</entryFree>
clupea: <entryFree id="n8674" type="main" key="clu^pe^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clŭpĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n8674.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of very small river-fish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 15, 17, § 44</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
clupeae: <entryFree id="n8675" type="main" key="Clu^pe^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clŭpĕae</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Clyp-</orth>), ārum; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Clŭpĕa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Clyp-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:7:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 4, 3, § 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:2:19" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 2, 19</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n8675.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town and promontory in</hi> Africa propria, now <hi rend="ital">Kalibia</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Clybea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 23</bibl>; Auct. B. Afr. 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:32" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 32</bibl> (also called Aspis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:244" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 244</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 27</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
clupeus: <entryFree id="n8676" type="main" key="clu^pe^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clŭpĕus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. clipeus.</entryFree>
clura: <entryFree id="n8677" type="gloss" key="clura"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clura</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pi/qhkos</foreign>, <sense id="n8677.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ape</hi>, Vet. Gloss. Labb. (Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kolou/ra</foreign>).—Hence,</sense></entryFree>
clurinus: <entryFree id="n8678" type="main" key="clu_ri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clūrīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>clura</etym>, <sense id="n8678.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to apes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, p. 110</bibl>; cf.: clura <foreign lang="greek">pi/qhkos</foreign>, cluria <foreign lang="greek">kepkopi/qhkos</foreign>, Vet. Gloss.</sense></entryFree>
clusaris: <entryFree id="n8679" type="main" key="clu_sa_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clūsāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cludo = claudo</etym>, <sense id="n8679.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">easily shutting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">closing</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">anguli, Hyg. ap. Goes. p. 181: portio quadrata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> p. 156</bibl></cit>.—Access. form * <orth extent="full" lang="la">clūsārĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um: latus, Hyg. ap. Goes. p. 183.</sense></entryFree>
clusilis: <entryFree id="n8680" type="hapax" key="clu_si^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clūsĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n8680.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">easily closing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mordacesque conchae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 37, 61, § 132</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
clusium: <entryFree id="n8681" type="main" key="Clu_si^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clūsĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n8681.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the oldest and most important towns of Etruria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the residence of Porsenna</hi>, <hi rend="ital">previously called</hi> Camars or Camers, now <hi rend="ital">Chiusi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:33:4 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 33, 4 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:25:11" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 25, 11</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 13, 19, § 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:167 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 167 al.</bibl>; Müll. Etrusk. 1, p. 102; 1, p. 233 sq.; 2, p. 342.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n8681.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Clūsīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Clusium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of Clusium</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulgus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:480" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 480</bibl></cit>: fontes (<hi rend="ital">cold baths</hi>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">far (of special whiteness and excellence),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:6:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">siligo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 9, 20, § 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pultes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 8</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Clūsīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Clusium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 33, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">novi, veteres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 8, § 52</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
clusius: <entryFree id="n8682" type="main" key="Clu_si^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clūsĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cludo = claudo</etym>, <sense id="n8682.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cognomen of Janus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose temple was closed in peace</hi> (opp. Patulcius, when open during war), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:130" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 130</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Clusivius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
clusor: <entryFree id="n8683" type="hapax" key="clu_sor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clūsor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n8683.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who encloses</hi> or <hi rend="ital">encompasses</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cluster: <entryFree id="n8684" type="main" key="cluster"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cluster</orth>, <itype>ēris</itype>, v. clyster.</entryFree>
clusura: <entryFree id="n8685" type="main" key="clu_su_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clūsūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. clausura.</entryFree>
clusus: <entryFree id="n8686" type="main" key="clu_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clūsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. <itype>claudo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
clutomestoridysarchides: <entryFree id="n8687" type="main" key="Clu^to^mesto_ri^dy^sarchi^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clŭtŏmestōrĭdysarchĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n8687.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a comically formed name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 14</bibl> Brix (by Lorenz written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
clutus: <entryFree id="n8688" type="gloss" key="clu^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clŭtus</orth> = Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kluto/s</foreign>, <sense id="n8688.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">famous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">renowned;</hi> hence, inclitus, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=55:14" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 55, 14</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
cluvia: <entryFree id="n8689" type="greek" key="Clu^vi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clŭvĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n8689.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Samnium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:31:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 31, 2</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n8689.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Clŭvĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Cluvia</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppugnatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:31:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 31, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cluvius: <entryFree id="n8690" type="main" key="Cluvius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cluvius</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n8690.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:14:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 14, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:56:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 56, 1 sq.</bibl> —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cluviāna</orth> <itype>hereditas</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of a Cluvius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:46:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 46, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
clybatis: <entryFree id="n8691" type="greek" key="cly^ba^tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clybătis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">klu/batis</foreign>, <sense id="n8691.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> helxine: Parietaria officinalis, Linn.; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 81</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
clymene: <entryFree id="n8692" type="main" key="Cly^me^ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clymĕnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*klume/nh</foreign>. <sense id="n8692.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The wife of the Ethiopian king Merops</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and mother of Phaëthon by Sol</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:756" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 756</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 765</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 37</bibl>; 4, 204.—Gr. <case>acc.</case> Clymenen, Ov. <cb n="CNID" /> M. 1, 756.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n8692.1" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Clymĕnēïus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Clymene</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proles = Phaëthon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8692.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Clymĕ-nēïs</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a daughter of Clymene</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0800,001:ad Liv. 1:111" default="NO"><author>Albin.</author> ad Liv. 1, 111</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8692.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the daughters of Oceanus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:345" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 345</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8692.4" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A female servant and confidante of Helen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 257</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">17, 267</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Dict. Cret.</author> 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8692.5" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An Amazon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 163" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 163</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
clymenos: <entryFree id="n8693" type="greek" key="cly^me^no^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clymĕnŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">klu/menos</foreign>, <sense id="n8693.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unknown plant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 7, 33, § 70</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
clymenus: <entryFree id="n8694" type="main" key="Cly^me^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clymĕnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*klu/menos</foreign>. <sense id="n8694.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A cognomen of Pluto</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:757" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 757</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8694.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A companion of Phineus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 98</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8694.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king of Arcadia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 206 al" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 206 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
clypeae: <entryFree id="n8695" type="main" key="Clype^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clypĕae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, v. Clupeae.</entryFree>
clypeo: <entryFree id="n8696" type="main" key="cly^pe^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clypĕo</orth>, v. clipeo.</entryFree>
clypeum: <entryFree id="n8697" type="main" key="cly^pe^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clypĕum</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">clypĕus</orth>, v. clipeus.</entryFree>
clysmus: <entryFree id="n8698" type="greek" key="clysmus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clysmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">klusmo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n8698.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a clyster</hi> (late Lat. for clyster), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 155" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 155</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:194" default="NO">194</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:197" default="NO">197</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
clyster: <entryFree id="n8699" type="greek" key="clyster"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clyster</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">cluster</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 179" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 179</bibl>), ēris (<case>abl.</case> clystĕre, Aem. Mac. cap. de anetho), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">klusth/r</foreign>. <sense id="n8699.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A clyster</hi>, <hi rend="ital">injection</hi> (pure Lat. lotio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 12</bibl>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 154" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 154</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:179 al" default="NO">179 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 5, 23, § 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:20 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 20 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n8699.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A clyster-pipe</hi> or <hi rend="ital">syringe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 6, 33, § 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 2, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oricularius,</quote> <trans><tr>an ear-syringe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:1" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
clysterium: <entryFree id="n8700" type="greek" key="clyste_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clystērĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">klusth/rion</foreign>, <sense id="n8700.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a clyster</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 114" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:118" default="NO">118</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=78:13" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 78, 13</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
clysterizo: <entryFree id="n8701" type="greek" key="clyste_ri_zo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clystērīzo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">klusthri/zw</foreign>, <sense id="n8701.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to apply a clyster</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:4" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 15, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 17, 3</bibl> (in <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 42</bibl>, clysterio is used).</sense></entryFree>
clytaemnestra: <entryFree id="n8702" type="main" key="Cly^taemne_stra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clytaemnēstra</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Clytemnēstra</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0094,001:11" default="NO"><author>Liv. Andron.</author> 11</bibl> Rib.; mutilated into <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cly-temēstra</orth>, Cass. Hemin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 7, 631</bibl>; hence the second syllable short in <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epit. Her. 1, 1, 4</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*klutaimnh/stra</foreign>, <sense id="n8702.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the daughter of Tyndarus and Leda</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and sister of Helen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Castor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and Pollux; wife of Agamemnon and mother of Orestes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Iphigenia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and Electra;</hi> she, with her paramour, Aegisthus, murdered her husband on his return from Troy, and was on that account put to death by her son Orestes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 117" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 117</bibl> and 240; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 2, 601</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 331</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 471</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 10, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 16, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:13:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 13, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 7, 9</bibl>; id. Nux, 26.—</sense><sense id="n8702.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">As title of a tragedy of Attius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:31:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 31, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 2 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n8702.2" n="B" level="2"> Appellative for <hi rend="ital">an unfaithful wife</hi>, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:53" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
clytidae: <entryFree id="n8703" type="main" key="Cly^ti_dae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clytīdae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n8703.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a family of haruspices at Elis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:41:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 41, 91</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
clytie: <entryFree id="n8704" type="main" key="Cly^ti^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clytĭē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kluti/h</foreign>, <sense id="n8704.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the daughters of Oceanus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">changed to the plant</hi> heliotropium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 206</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 234</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 256</bibl> sq.</sense></entryFree>
clytius: <entryFree id="n8705" type="main" key="Cly^ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clytĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n8705.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of several heroes mentioned in</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:774" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 774</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 129</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 325 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n8705.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A companion of Phineus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 140</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
clytus: <entryFree id="n8706" type="main" key="Cly^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clytus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n8706.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Ægyptus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 170" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 170</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8706.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A companion of Phineus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 87</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8706.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A prœtor of the Acarnanians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:11:8 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 11, 8 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
cnaeus: <entryFree id="n8707" type="main" key="Cnaeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cnaeus</orth>, v. Gneus.</entryFree>
cnasonas: <entryFree id="n8708" type="gloss" key="cnasonas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cnasonas</orth> <itype>acus, quibus mulieres caput scalpunt</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=52:17" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 52, 17</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
cnecus: <entryFree id="n8709" type="greek" key="cne_cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cnēcus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cnīcus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">knh=kos</foreign>, <sense id="n8709.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">safflower</hi>: Carthamus tinctorius, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 15, 53, § 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:184" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 32, 107, § 184</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:8:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 135" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 135</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cnedinus: <entryFree id="n8710" type="greek" key="cne_di^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cnēdĭnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cnīd-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">knh/dinos</foreign>, <sense id="n8710.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of nettles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nettle-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 7, 7, § 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cnemis: <entryFree id="n8711" type="greek" key="cne_mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cnēmis</orth>, <itype>īdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">knhmi/s</foreign>, <sense id="n8711.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a greave;</hi> fig. <hi rend="ital">of the end of the verse</hi>, Mall. Theod. Metr. 4, 12.</sense></entryFree>
cneoron: <entryFree id="n8712" type="greek" key="cne^o_ron"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cnĕōron</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kne/wron</foreign> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">cnē-stron</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">knh=stron</foreign>), <sense id="n8712.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> thymelaea, <hi rend="ital">mezereon</hi>: Daphne gnidium, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 21, 35, § 114</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cnephosus: <entryFree id="n8713" type="gloss" key="cne^pho_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cnĕphōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym><foreign lang="greek">kne/fas</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n8713.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dark</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=51:9" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 51, 9</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
cneus: <entryFree id="n8714" type="main" key="Cne_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cnēus</orth>, v. Cnaeus.</entryFree>
cnicus: <entryFree id="n8715" type="main" key="cni_cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cnīcus</orth>, v. cnecus.</entryFree>
cnide: <entryFree id="n8716" type="greek" key="cni_de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cnīdē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kni/dh</foreign>, <sense id="n8716.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sea-nettle;</hi> pure Lat. urtica (q. v.), <hi rend="ital">a zoophyte</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 146</bibl>. <pb n="356" /> <cb n="COAC" /></sense></entryFree>
cnidius: <entryFree id="n8717" type="main" key="Cni^di^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cnĭdĭus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cnĭdus</orth>, v. Gnĭdus.</entryFree>
cnisa: <entryFree id="n8718" type="greek" key="cni_sa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cnīsa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cnissa</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kni=sa</foreign>, <sense id="n8718.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the steam</hi> or <hi rend="ital">odor of a sacrifice</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, p. 212</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cnodax: <entryFree id="n8719" type="greek" key="cno_dax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cnōdax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">knw/dac</foreign>; in mechanics, <sense id="n8719.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pivot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gudgeon;</hi> Fr. <hi rend="ital">pivōt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boulons</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 2, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cnosos: <entryFree id="n8720" type="main" key="Cno_sos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cnōsos, Cnōsĭus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Cnōsĭăcus</orth>, etc., v. Gnosus.</entryFree>
coa: <entryFree id="n8721" type="main" key="Coa1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Coa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. Cos, II.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n8722" type="main" key="Co^a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n8722.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fictitious nickname of Clodia</hi> [from coeo; opp. Nola, from nolo], Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:53" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coaccedo: <entryFree id="n8723" type="hapax" key="co^acce_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-accēdo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n8723.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to come to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">be added besides</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 65</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coacervatim: <entryFree id="n8724" type="main" key="co^a^cerva_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏăcervātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>coacervatus, from coacervo</etym>, <sense id="n8724.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in heaps</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">offerre aliquid,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 2, p. 347, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:3" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coacervatio: <entryFree id="n8725" type="main" key="co^a^cerva_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏăcervātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>coacervo</etym>. * <sense id="n8725.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A heaping together.</hi> </sense><sense id="n8725.1" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">stratae viae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 15, 16, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8725.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">actionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:1:11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 1, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8725.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A rhetorical figure</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:35:122" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 35, 122</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:53" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coacervo: <entryFree id="n8726" type="main" key="co^a^cervo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-ăcervo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8726.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to heap together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heap up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">collect in a mass</hi> (class., esp. in prose; most freq. in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n8726.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniae coguntur et coacervantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:27:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 27, 70</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum (argenti, etc.) in turbā et rapinis coacervari unā in domo potuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:46:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 46, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantam vim emblematum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:24:section=54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 24, § 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudinem civium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 57</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">148: cadavera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hostium cumulos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armorum cumulos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:39:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 39, 1</bibl></cit>: omnis res aliquo, Auct. B. Afr. 91: bustum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:363" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 363</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">summas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:1:36" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17, 1, 36</bibl></cit>.—Sarcastically: agros non modo emere verum etiam coacervare, <hi rend="ital">not merely to purchase</hi> (perh. to sell again), <hi rend="ital">but to heap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">collect together in a mass</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:25:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 25, 66</bibl> Orell.— </sense><sense id="n8726.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:11:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 11, 40</bibl></cit>: luctus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:485" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 485</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">errores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 1, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
coacesco: <entryFree id="n8727" type="main" key="co^a^cesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-ăcesco</orth>, <itype>ăcŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n8727.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become acid</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sour</hi> (rare but in good prose). </sense><sense id="n8727.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">genus uvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:65:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 65, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut non omne vinum, sic non omnis aetas vetustate coacescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:18:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 18, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:6:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 6, 9</bibl> pr.: <cit><quote lang="la">secunda mensa in imbecillo stomacho coacescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si coacuit intus cibus aut computruit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> —</sense><sense id="n8727.2" n="II" level="1"> Trop (the fig. drawn from wine): quare cum integri nihil fuerit in hac gente plenā, quam valde eam putamus tot transfusionibus coacuisse? <hi rend="ital">to deteriorate</hi> or <hi rend="ital">become corrupt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,029:22:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Scaur. 22, 43</bibl> B. and K.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:18:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 18, 65</bibl> supra.</sense></entryFree>
coacte: <entryFree id="n8728" type="main" key="co^acte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏactē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. cogo, <sense id="n8728.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
coactiliarius: <entryFree id="n8729" type="gloss" key="co^acti^li^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏactĭlĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>coactilis</etym>, <sense id="n8729.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a maker of thick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fulled cloth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">LANARIVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4206</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">taberna,</quote> <trans><tr>a fulling-mill</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Pert. 3</bibl></cit>; but v. coctilicius.</sense></entryFree>
coactilis: <entryFree id="n8730" type="main" key="co^acti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏactĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>coactus, cogo</etym>, <sense id="n8730.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made thick;</hi> hence <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏactĭlĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">thick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fulled cloth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">felt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:26" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 26</bibl>; cf. Edict. Diocl. p. 21.</sense></entryFree>
coactim: <entryFree id="n8731" type="hapax" key="co^actim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏactim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym> (of expression), <sense id="n8731.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">concisely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">briefly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coactio: <entryFree id="n8732" type="main" key="co^acti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏactĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cogo</etym> (post-Aug. and rare). * <sense id="n8732.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A collecting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calling in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">coactiones argentarias factitavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 1</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n8732.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An abridgment</hi> or <hi rend="ital">epitome of a discourse</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 4, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8732.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A disease of animals</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Art. Vet. 2, 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 10, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 15, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coacto: <entryFree id="n8733" type="main" key="co^acto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏacto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n8733.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to constrain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">force</hi> (only twice in Lucr.); with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1121</bibl> and 1160.</sense></entryFree>
coactor: <entryFree id="n8734" type="main" key="co^actor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏactor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n8734.0" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n8734.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A collector of money</hi> (from auctions, of revenues, etc.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 150, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:64:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 64, 180</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 11, 30</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 86</bibl>; cf. Acron. and Porphyr. in h. l. and Auct. Vit. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 81:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 81, 2</bibl> (al. decoctor).— </sense><sense id="n8734.2" n="B" level="2"> Coactores agminis, <hi rend="ital">the rear</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 68</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8734.3" n="C" level="2"> ( = coactiliarius.) <hi rend="ital">A fuller</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 648, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8734.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">one who forces to something</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adjutor, et, ut ita dicam, coactor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 52:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 52, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
coactura: <entryFree id="n8735" type="hapax" key="co^actu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏactūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>; <sense id="n8735.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">concr.,</quote> <trans><tr>a collection</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:50:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 50, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
coactus: <entryFree id="n8736" type="main" key="co^actus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. cogo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n8737" type="main" key="co^actus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏactus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cogo</etym>, <sense id="n8737.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a forcing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">constraint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compulsion</hi> (rare and only in <cb n="COAG" /> <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>): alterius magno coactu, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:273" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 273</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">coactu atque efflagitatu meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:29:section=75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 29, § 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 13, § 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
coaddo: <entryFree id="n8738" type="main" key="co^addo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-addo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8738.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to add with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">add also</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 40, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 1, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coadjutor: <entryFree id="n8739" type="main" key="co^adju_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-adjūtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = adjutor, <sense id="n8739.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an assistant</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3427</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coadoro: <entryFree id="n8740" type="main" key="co^a^do_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-ădōro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8740.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to worship</hi> or <hi rend="ital">adore along with</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Spir. Sanct. 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 1, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coadulesco: <entryFree id="n8741" type="main" key="co^a^du^lesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-ădŭlesco</orth>, <itype>ēvi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n8741.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow up along with</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coadunatio: <entryFree id="n8742" type="hapax" key="co^a^du_na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏădūnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>coaduno</etym>, <sense id="n8742.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a uniting into one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a summing up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">totius calculi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 5, 12, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
coaduno: <entryFree id="n8743" type="main" key="co^a^du_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-ădūno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8743.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to unite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">add</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">join together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to collect into one</hi> (postclass.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:4:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 10, 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:14:9" default="NO">2, 14, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vit. 1" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vit. 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Dict. Cret.</author> 4, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coaedifico: <entryFree id="n8744" type="main" key="co^aedi^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-aedĭfĭco</orth>, no <sense id="n8744.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to build up together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">build upon</hi> (only in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">Campum Martium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:33:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 33, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loci coaedificati an vasti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:10:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 10, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quarta pars (urbis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:53:section=119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 53, § 119</bibl></cit> Zumpt <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> (al. aedificata).</sense></entryFree>
coaegresco: <entryFree id="n8745" type="main" key="co^aegresco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-aegresco</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <sense id="n8745.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become sick at the same time with</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 5</bibl> dub. (al. cohaerescit).</sense></entryFree>
